Title: Vidqu Face Swap Tool Review: The easiest way to create realistic AI face swap videos
Summary: Vidqu Face Swap Tool Review: The easiest way to create realistic AI face swap videos . Creating videos is getting easier every year and one of the most popular trends today is face swapping .

Title: NDLEA arrests 49-year-old man in Ogun for storing 347kg of cannabis sativa
Summary: NDLEA arrests 49-year-old man for allegedly stocking 347kg of cannabis sativa . Fatokun Rahmon, 49, was arrested in a warehouse located in Rounda, Ogun State .

Title: Amotekun vows watertight security in Southwest
Summary: The Western Nigerian Security Network, otherwise known as the Amotekun Corps, has assured that the South-West region of the country will be fully fortified against bandits and terrorists facing military onslaught in North-West and North-East .

Title: Tinubu to launch unemployment benefits scheme – Deputy Speaker
Summary: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu is set to launch an unemployment benefits scheme . The scheme is aimed at cushioning the effects of joblessness among Nigerian youths . Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives, Benjamin Kalu, made the disclosure .

Title: Infantino defends World Cup ticket prices, cites ‘crazy’ demand
Summary: FIFA President Gianni Infantino defends controversial ticket prices for the 2026 World Cup . FIFA President says organisers had received a record 150 million requests for tickets in the past two weeks . Speaking at the World Sports Summit in Dubai, he cited ‘crazy’ demand for tickets .

Title: Southeast will vote massively for Tinubu, says Umahi
Summary: Minister of Works, David Umahi, says Southeast geopolitical zone will deliver massive support for President Bola Tinubu in 2027 general election .

Title: NDDC presents N1.75trn Budget, vows deeper reforms, results
Summary: The Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC) presented a proposed N1.75 trillion 2025 Budget on Tuesday . The budget signals a decisive shift from transactional governance to results-driven development strategy for the oil rich Niger Delta region .

Title: Ekpeye people to continue supporting Wike, Tinubu — Nwuche
Summary: People of Ekpeye in Ahoada East Local Government Area of Rivers State will continue to support President Bola Tinubu’s administration and his bid for reelection . The Chairman of the South South Development Commission, Rt. Hon. Chibudom Nwuche, has affirmed that the people will continue supporting

Title: NUC Approves 17 degree programmes for university of Fortune, Ondo
Summary: The National Universities Commission has approved the commencement of undergraduate degree programmes at the University of Fortune, Igbotako, Ondo State, beginning from the 2025/2026 academic session . The approval was contained in a letter dated December 29, 2025, and signed by the Acting Director of Academic Planning, Abubakar M. G

Title: 2025: How Nigerians paid more for data, calls despite network disruptions – Report
Summary: In 2025, Nigerians faced sharply higher costs for mobile voice calls, SMS, and data . Network quality and connectivity frequently fell short, leaving subscribers frustrated many times in the year .

Title: [LIVE UPDATE] AFCON 2025: Nigeria lead Uganda 1–0 at half-time
Summary: Nigeria have taken a first-half lead against Uganda in their final Group C match of the AFCON 2025 . Paul Onuachu made amends for an earlier miss, stretching to poke home a low cross from Fisayo Dele-Bashiru after a swift Nigerian attacking move . The goal put Nigeria firmly in control and extends

Title: Anthony Joshua's crash rude shock to family-Uncle
Summary: Anthony Joshua's uncle Adedamola Joshua has said that the news of the crash involving the legendary boxer on Monday came to the family as a rude shock . He said that no one could have thought that such a terrible thing could befall their proud son who could come to Nigeria three or four times in a year .

Title: Tinubu apppoints EFCC's Oyedepo as director of public prosecutions
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has approved the appointment of Rotimi Oyedepo, SAN, as the Director of Public Prosecutions in the Federal Ministry of Justice . He will succeed Abubakar Babadoko, who is due to retire on December 31, 2025, after completing the mandatory eight years as a director .

Title: NAICOM insists recapitalisation deadline stands, rules out extension
Summary: National Insurance Commission has insisted that there will be no extension of the ongoing recapitalisation deadline in the insurance industry, saying the timetable is fixed in law and cannot be shifted . Any change would require a fresh legislative process and presidential assent .

Title: FG rejects claims of secret task force targeting opposition
Summary: The Federal Government has refuted claims of a clandestine multi-agency operation aimed at unlawfully arresting, detaining, or prosecuting prominent opposition politicians . The government labeled a viral document on the matter as “fabricated” and part of deliberate disinformation .
